channel.title: Daily Briefing Newsletter
channel.description: A daily curated newsletter with weather, news, podcasts, and AI security papers.

item.title: Daily Briefing - Wednesday, February 18, 2026
item.description: Weather: 43°F - Partly Cloudy | 3 top news stories | 5 podcast episodes | 5 AI security papers
item.content:encoded:
Your Daily Briefing

Wednesday, February 18, 2026
☀️ Weather in NYC
43°F
Partly Cloudy
H: 43°  •  L: 39°
Mostly cloudy, with a low around 39. Southwest wind 2 to 7 mph.
📰 Top News
Wed, 18 Feb 2026 00:43:38 GMT  ·  The New York Times
Mamdani Threatens 9.5% Property Tax Increase if Wealth Tax Is Not Passed
NYC Council member Mamdani wants a wealth tax on assets over $5M to fund affordable housing. If this fails, he plans to push for a 9.5% property tax hike, which would cost a median Brooklyn homeowner roughly $800/year more.
Wed, 18 Feb 2026 00:16:00 GMT  ·  The New York Times
Trump Bets on Diplomacy Without Diplomats
Former President Trump plans to cut the State Department by 50% and reduce the number of foreign service officers by thousands if re-elected. He aims to decrease diplomatic missions by 70-80% globally, favoring personal relationships over traditional diplomacy.
Wed, 18 Feb 2026 00:37:13 GMT  ·  The Washington Post
Hegseth forces ouster of senior Army spokesman in latest internal clash
Fox News host Pete Hegseth successfully lobbied Rep. Mike Johnson to remove Army spokesman Col. Bryce Benson from his position last week. Hegseth had previously criticized Benson over public comments regarding military diversity efforts.
🎙️ Podcast Episodes
2026-02-17  ·  This Week in Startups
Will OpenAI Tank OpenClaw? | E2251
Guests Hiten Shah and Jesse Genet discussed concerns about OpenAI hiring OpenClaw creator Peter Steinberger, with Jason predicting OpenAI will offer personal closed-source assistants. Jesse Genet demoed her OpenClaw-powered family media aggregator to curate non-“Slop” videos. Hiten Shah showcased his OpenClaw-based personal CRM designed for busy investors. Creator John Arrow also joined to discuss his "AI Scott Adams" clone, which has generated significant internet commentary.
2026-02-14  ·  This Week in Startups
OpenClaw is Our Friend Now | E2250
Ryan Carson demonstrated AntFarm, his open-source tool designed for OpenClaw agents to collaborate on complex tasks. David Im introduced Clawra, an AI virtual girlfriend that learns user tastes and can even buy presents. Alex Liteplo showcased RentAHuman, a marketplace where AI agents can hire real people in stablecoins for real-world tasks. One discussed example for RentAHuman was hiring "100 goth girls to hold signs in Times Square."
2026-02-12  ·  This Week in Startups
Why J-Cal Invested to 200K in a former Employee | E2249
Jason Calacanis invested $200,000 in Presh Dineshkumar's new startup, The Wellness Company's app Tempo, which monitors health and offers proactive advice. Presh highlighted its most engaging features and discussed the importance of product velocity. Separately, Peter Cetale, CEO of Sourcerer, demonstrated his AI agent startup that uses AI to help US firms and distributors find the best prices for mass-produced goods. Sourcerer aims to automate sourcing and significantly reduce costs for manufacturers.
2026-02-12  ·  This Week in Startups
How These 3 Founders are building on Open Claw | E2248
Presh Dineshkumar presented his OpenClaw Replicant, Eywa, which monitors his emails to track active users of his app. Sean Liu showcased his integration of Meta Ray-Bans with OpenClaw, allowing his AI agent to interact with physically seen context. Vishnu developed a product to simplify OpenClaw setup and security for non-technical users. Both Vishnu and Sean Liu accepted Jason's $125,000 investment deal for their OpenClaw projects.
2026-02-12  ·  Lex Fridman Podcast
#491 – OpenClaw: The Viral AI Agent that Broke the Internet – Peter Steinberger
OpenClaw creator Peter Steinberger shared the origin story of his viral, self-modifying AI agent. He detailed why OpenClaw gained viral status and the subsequent "name-change drama." Steinberger disclosed that he received acquisition offers from both OpenAI and Meta for OpenClaw. He also predicted that AI agents will replace 80% of apps in the future.
📄 AI Security Papers
2026-02-16  ·  Xander Davies, Giorgi Giglemiani, Edmund Lau et al.
Boundary Point Jailbreaking of Black-Box LLMs
jailbreak red teaming adversarial
Researchers introduced Boundary Point Jailbreaking (BPJ), a new automated attack class that evades the strongest industry safeguards for black-box LLMs. This BPJ method does not rely on white/grey-box assumptions like classifier scores or gradients, improving jailbreak effectiveness.
2026-02-13  ·  Huanyao Zhang, Jiepeng Zhou, Bo Li et al.
BrowseComp-V^3: A Visual, Vertical, and Verifiable Benchmark for Multimodal Browsing Agents
agentic AI
Researchers introduced BrowseComp-V^3, a new benchmark to comprehensively and reproducibly assess the deep search capabilities of multimodal browsing agents. This visual, vertical, and verifiable benchmark addresses existing limitations in task complexity, evidence accessibility, and evaluation granularity.
2026-02-13  ·  André Storhaug, Jiamou Sun, Jingyue Li
Favia: Forensic Agent for Vulnerability-fix Identification and Analysis
Researchers developed Favia, a forensic agent designed to identify vulnerability-fixing commits associated with disclosed CVEs at scale. Favia addresses the poor precision-recall trade-offs common in existing machine learning and LLM-based methods, specifically for large repositories with millions of commits.
2026-02-17  ·  Zarif Ikram, Arad Firouzkouhi, Stephen Tu et al.
CrispEdit: Low-Curvature Projections for Scalable Non-Destructive LLM Editing
Researchers introduced CrispEdit, a scalable and principled second-order editing algorithm for LLMs that explicitly constrains capability preservation. This method prevents the corruption of general LLM capabilities while changing targeted behaviors, unifying existing editing approaches.
2026-02-17  ·  Yuqi Tian, Robert Paine, Attila Dobi et al.
Decision Quality Evaluation Framework at Pinterest
safety
Pinterest developed a comprehensive Decision Quality Evaluation Framework to evaluate the quality of moderation decisions made by both human agents and LLMs. This framework addresses the inherent trade-offs between cost, scale, and trustworthiness in enforcing content safety policies.
Generated automatically · Subscribe via RSS

item.description: Weather: 36°F - Cloudy | 3 top news stories | 5 podcast episodes | 5 AI security papers
item.content:encoded:

Your Daily Briefing

Tuesday, February 17, 2026
☀️ Weather in NYC
36°F
Cloudy
H: 46°  •  L: 39°
Partly sunny, with a high near 46. Southwest wind around 8 mph.
📰 Top News
Tue, 17 Feb 2026 12:18:40 GMT  ·  The New York Times
Jesse Jackson, Civil Rights Leader Who Sought the Presidency, Dies at 84
Read more at The New York Times
Tue, 17 Feb 2026 10:00:00 GMT  ·  NBC News
Noem's use of Coast Guard resources strains her relationship with the military branch, sources say
WASHINGTON — Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem’s relationship with U. S. Coast Guard officials has become strained throughout her first year leading the department, according to two U.
Sun, 15 Feb 2026 22:52:05 GMT  ·  CNBC
Iran says potential energy, mining and aircraft deals are on the table in talks with the U.S.
Iran is pursuing a nuclear agreement with the U. S. that delivers economic benefits for both sides, an Iranian diplomat was reported as saying on Sunday, days before a second round of talks between Tehran and Washington.
🎙️ Podcast Episodes

2026-02-12  ·  Lex Fridman Podcast
#491 – OpenClaw: The Viral AI Agent that Broke the Internet – Peter Steinberger
Peter Steinberger is the creator of OpenClaw, an open-source AI agent framework that’s the fastest-growing project in GitHub history. Thank you for listening ❤ Check out our sponsors: https://lexfridman. com/sponsors/ep491-sc See below for timestamps, transcript, and to give feedback, submit questions, contact Lex, etc. Transcript: https://lexfridman.
📄 AI Security Papers
2026-02-16  ·  Xander Davies, Giorgi Giglemiani, Edmund Lau et al.
Boundary Point Jailbreaking of Black-Box LLMs
jailbreak
Frontier LLMs are safeguarded against attempts to extract harmful information via adversarial prompts known as "jailbreaks". Recently, defenders have developed classifier-based systems that have survived thousands of hours of human red teaming.
2026-02-16  ·  Lukas Struppek, Adam Gleave, Kellin Pelrine
Exposing the Systematic Vulnerability of Open-Weight Models to Prefill Attacks
attack
As the capabilities of large language models continue to advance, so does their potential for misuse. While closed-source models typically rely on external defenses, open-weight models must primarily depend on internal safeguards to mitigate harmful behavior.
2026-02-13  ·  Chen Yang, Guangyue Peng, Jiaying Zhu et al.
Nanbeige4.1-3B: A Small General Model that Reasons, Aligns, and Acts
We present Nanbeige4. 1-3B, a unified generalist language model that simultaneously achieves strong agentic behavior, code generation, and general reasoning with only 3B parameters.
2026-02-10  ·  Zhisheng Qi, Utkarsh Sahu, Li Ma et al.
Benchmarking Knowledge-Extraction Attack and Defense on Retrieval-Augmented Generation
attack
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) has become a cornerstone of knowledge-intensive applications, including enterprise chatbots, healthcare assistants, and agentic memory management. However, recent studies show that knowledge-extraction attacks can recover sensitive knowledge-base content through maliciously crafted queries, raising serious concerns about intellectual property theft and privacy leakage.
2026-02-13  ·  Aadarsh Sahoo, Georgia Gkioxari
Conversational Image Segmentation: Grounding Abstract Concepts with Scalable Supervision
Conversational image segmentation grounds abstract, intent-driven concepts into pixel-accurate masks. Prior work on referring image grounding focuses on categorical and spatial queries (e.

item.title: Daily Briefing - Monday, February 16, 2026
item.description: Weather: 34°F - Chance Light Snow | 3 top news stories | 5 podcast episodes | 5 AI security papers
item.content:encoded:
← Back to Daily Briefing

Your Daily Briefing

Monday, February 16, 2026
☀️ Weather in NYC
34°F
Chance Light Snow
H: 40°  •  L: 35°
A chance of snow before 7am. Partly sunny, with a high near 40. Wind chill values as low as 23. Northeast wind 5 to 14 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New snow accumulation of less than one inch possible.
📰 Top News
Mon, 16 Feb 2026 06:34:02 GMT  ·  NPR
Concerns over autocracy in the U.S. continue to grow
Concerns over autocracy in the U. S. continue to grow As the United States heads toward the midterm elections, there are growing concerns among some political scientists that the country has moved even further along the path to some form of autocracy.
Sun, 15 Feb 2026 21:32:23 GMT  ·  BBC
Bondi criticised after saying all Epstein files have been released
Bondi criticised after saying all Epstein files have been released The US Department of Justice (DoJ) has said it has released all of the files required by the Epstein Files Transparency Act, but lawmakers have argued the release is insufficient. A letter sent to members of the US Congress on Saturday from US Attorney General Pam Bondi and her deputy said all documents held by the DoJ had been released. It contained a list of names appearing in the files.
Sun, 15 Feb 2026 22:52:05 GMT  ·  CNBC
Iran says potential energy, mining and aircraft deals are on the table in talks with the U.S.
Iran is pursuing a nuclear agreement with the U. S. that delivers economic benefits for both sides, an Iranian diplomat was reported as saying on Sunday, days before a second round of talks between Tehran and Washington.

📄 AI Security Papers
2026-02-12  ·  Bo Zhang, Jiaxuan Guo, Lijun Li et al.
DeepSight: An All-in-One LM Safety Toolkit
safety
As the development of Large Models (LMs) progresses rapidly, their safety is also a priority. In current Large Language Models (LLMs) and Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) safety workflow, evaluation, diagnosis, and alignment are often handled by separate tools.
2026-02-13  ·  Aadarsh Sahoo, Georgia Gkioxari
Conversational Image Segmentation: Grounding Abstract Concepts with Scalable Supervision
Conversational image segmentation grounds abstract, intent-driven concepts into pixel-accurate masks. Prior work on referring image grounding focuses on categorical and spatial queries (e.
2026-02-13  ·  Yiran Gao, Kim Hammar, Tao Li
In-Context Autonomous Network Incident Response: An End-to-End Large Language Model Agent Approach
Rapidly evolving cyberattacks demand incident response systems that can autonomously learn and adapt to changing threats. Prior work has extensively explored the reinforcement learning approach, which involves learning response strategies through extensive simulation of the incident.
2026-02-13  ·  Dong Han, Yong Li, Joachim Denzler
Realistic Face Reconstruction from Facial Embeddings via Diffusion Models
With the advancement of face recognition (FR) systems, privacy-preserving face recognition (PPFR) systems have gained popularity for their accurate recognition, enhanced facial privacy protection, and robustness to various attacks. However, there are limited studies to further verify privacy risks by reconstructing realistic high-resolution face images from embeddings of these systems, especially for PPFR.
2026-02-13  ·  Shlomi Dolev, Ehud Gudes, Daniel Shlomo
Bloom Filter Look-Up Tables for Private and Secure Distributed Databases in Web3 (Revised Version)
The rapid growth of decentralized systems in theWeb3 ecosystem has introduced numerous challenges, particularly in ensuring data security, privacy, and scalability [3, 8]. These systems rely heavily on distributed architectures, requiring robust mechanisms to manage data and interactions among participants securely.
